title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest adopted No. 55 at USC, a tradition started by Junior Seau, becoming iconic in the NFL.
McGinest wore No. 55 during his Patriots tenure from 1994-2005, winning three Super Bowls and becoming second in all-time sacks.
Junior Seau joined the Patriots in 2006 and wore No. 55 with McGinest's blessing, continuing the jersey's legacy.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County received the highest snow totals, with Salisbury and Beverly each reporting 13 inches on February 7.
Bristol County reported significant snowfall, with Dartmouth receiving 8.2 inches as measured by amateur radio.
Barnstable County experienced lighter snowfall, with most locations reporting under 1 inch, according to COCORAHS observers.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC when the Patriots face the Seahawks in California.
Tirico has covered events like the Olympics, Kentucky Derby, and Indianapolis 500 since joining NBC in 2016.
Following the Super Bowl, Tirico will host NBC's Olympic program from Levi's Stadium as part of a busy schedule.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks will face off in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
Drake Maye, the Patriots' quarterback, aims to become the youngest Super Bowl-winning QB at 23 years old.
The Seahawks have the best scoring defense, allowing 17.2 points per game, while Patriots average 28.8 points per game.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid ahead of his first Super Bowl LX.
Vrabel relied on offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels, who is attending his 10th Super Bowl, for preparation advice.
In his first year, Vrabel led the Patriots to 14 wins, earning the NFL Coach of the Year award.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots can surpass the Steelers for the most Super Bowl wins by winning their seventh title against the Seahawks.
Quarterback Drake Maye could join Tom Brady and others as second-year quarterbacks to win a Super Bowl.
Coach Mike Vrabel aims to become the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both a player and coach.

title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims for a Super Bowl LX victory to boost his Hall of Fame credentials.
Diggs, a Patriots WR, has four Pro Bowls and two All-Pro nods in his career.
Diggs ranks 38th in receiving yards and 43rd in touchdowns, hoping to move into the top 15 in both.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri was named to the Pro Football Hall of Fame, recognizing his prolific career as a kicker.
Vinatieri scored 2,673 points over 24 seasons, holding the record for most points in NFL history.
He played 10 seasons with the Patriots, winning three Super Bowls before joining the Colts for 14 more seasons.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel simulated a long halftime at Friday's practice to prepare for Super Bowl LX.
Quarterback Drake Maye participated fully; Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited in practice due to injuries.
Bad Bunny will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, with rumors of guest appearance by Cardi B.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye and Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold to face off in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium.
The match may hinge on which quarterback makes fewer mistakes, as both defenses are highly ranked.
Key players include Patriots' Milton Williams and Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba, with both teams being well-coached and evenly matched.
